department_name: Imperial County Public Health Department - Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: Uses letter grades A, B, C based on numerical score (100-point system with deductions). Scores below 70 result in closure without grade issuance.

inspection_details.frequency: Routine inspections conducted by Environmental Health Specialists, with annual permit renewal required by December 31st
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: C grade facilities must request written re-inspection within 30 days or face closure. B grade facilities can request one re-score inspection per calendar year with fee.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Letter Grade Cards must be posted in easily visible location, inspection reports available on-site upon request

facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems required per California Fire Code and NFPA standards

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - Part of California Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Imperial County Environmental Health Division
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Imperial County implements California Retail Food Code with local enforcement through Environmental Health Division

confidence_notes: Letter grade system (A/B/C) is confirmed from official Imperial County documents. Specific numerical grade thresholds are mentioned but not fully detailed in the available documentation. Fire inspection requirements are verified through Imperial County Fire Department sources.
verification_notes: Need to verify exact numerical score thresholds for A/B/C grades. The Imperial County inspection guide mentions the grading system but specific score ranges for each letter grade are not explicitly stated in the documents found.
